intro: Tanacetum kotschyi, commonly known as the Armenian tansy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers are arranged in flat-topped clusters, and it produces small, dark brown seeds in a pappus. Tanacetum kotschyi is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate and alpine climates.
